CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-4 - Review of lawfulness of detention);Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-5 - Compensation)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was taken into custody on suspicion of membership of a terrorist organisation and disseminating its propaganda .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was brought before the Siirt Magistrates’ Court , who ordered his detention on remand taking into account the strong suspicion that he had committed the alleged offences .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s lawyer filed an objection against the above decision on the applicant ’s detention and requested his release .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG public prosecutor filed a bill of indictment , charging the applicant with disseminating terrorist propaganda , and aiding and abetting a terrorist organisation .
CARDINAL . On DATE , at the end of the preparatory hearing , ORG decided to prolong the applicant ’s detention on the basis of the case - file .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ex officio examined the applicant ’s detention on remand on the basis of the case - file and decided to extend it .
CARDINAL . On DATE , at DATE first hearing before ORG , the applicant was released pending trial .
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE ORG acquitted the applicant of the charges against him . No appeal was filed and the judgment became final on DATE .
